subject: RE: [junit] Test Locator
msgSnippet: Hello, You may want to look into the junit.runner.ClassPathTestCollector class to see how it it done in junit and then go from there.  Below is the a javadoc
messageBody:
Hello,

You may want to look into the junit.runner.ClassPathTestCollector class
to see how it it done in junit and then go from there. Below is the a
javadoc entry for the ClassPathTestCollector to help determine if this
is where you should go.

/**
* An implementation of a TestCollector that consults the
* class path. It considers all classes on the class path
* excluding classes in JARs. It leaves it up to subclasses
* to decide whether a class is a runnable Test.
*
* @see TestCollector
*/
public abstract class ClassPathTestCollector implements TestCollector


You will still have to look at executing the test, but I believe that
you can look at junit.runner.LoadingTestCollector , and
junit.runner.TestCaseClassLoader to get a feel for how the test cases
can be loaded.

Overall, I think you will find that the JUNIT SOURCE jar file (src.jar)
has more than enough code to give you a good idea of how to write an app
that will do exactly what you need.

Good Luck,

--Ryan

-----Original Message-----
From: DiFrango, Ron [mailto:ron.difrango@...]
Sent: Friday, March 08, 2002 1:51 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] Test Locator


Guys,

I know that I have seen something about this, but I could not find it
anywhere. What I am looking for is code that will search the classpath
for all the available tests. If it could also execute the tests that
would be great.

I do know that this is available as an ANT task, but it is not possible
at this time to add that into our ANT build process.

Thanks in advance,

Ron
